sentences.en: A prince turns into a frog in this cartoon fairytale.
sentences.cn: 在这个卡通童话里王子变成了一只青蛙。

sentences.en: At tea-time, Victoria sang duets with her Consort, Prince Albert.
sentences.cn: 喝下午茶的时候，维多利亚与其夫君艾伯特亲王表演了二重唱。

sentences.en: He is grander and even richer than the Prince of Wales.
sentences.cn: 他比威尔士亲王还牛气，甚至更有钱。

sentences.en: His paintings beguiled the Prince of Wales.
sentences.cn: 他的画把威尔士亲王给迷住了。

sentences.en: Julia Samuel was one of Prince Andrew's old flames.
sentences.cn: 朱莉娅·塞缪尔是安德鲁王子的旧欢之一。

sentences.en: Prince Edward threw the switch to light the illuminations.
sentences.cn: 爱德华王子按动开关亮起彩灯。

sentences.en: Prince Michael of Kent presented the prizes.
sentences.cn: 肯特亲王迈克尔颁发了奖品。

sentences.en: Prince Sadruddin lavished praise on Britain's contributions to world diplomacy.
sentences.cn: 萨德鲁丁王子大力赞扬英国对世界外交作出的贡献。

sentences.en: Sometimes he had overacted in his role as Prince.
sentences.cn: 有时候，他把王子一角演得过于夸张。

sentences.en: The prince should be plunged into work.
sentences.cn: 王子应该积极参与工作。

sentences.en: The Prince was driving with great fire and dash.
sentences.cn: 王子潇洒威猛地驱车而行。

sentences.en: The Prince's destiny was predetermined from the moment of his birth.
sentences.cn: 从出生的那一刻起，王子的命运就已经被预先决定了。

sentences.en: The Prince's words had been misinterpreted.
To his 19th-century peers, Robert Brown was the prince of botany.
sentences.cn: 对于19世纪的同行来说，罗伯特·布朗是植物学巨匠。

words.tran_cn: 王子的，高贵的；慷慨的；豪华的
君王的地位或头衔；王子的领土

phrases.tran_cn: n. 富商；有影响力的商人
乔治王子城（加拿大城市）
n. 威尔士亲王（英国皇太子之封号）

trans.tran_cn: 王子，巨头，（某些欧洲国家的）贵族，小国的君主，王孙，亲王
trans.tran_en: the son of a king, queen, or prince
